isuues.value: Animal Husbandry, Dairying & Fisheries,Agriculture,Disaster Management,Micro Finance (SHGs),Micro Small & Medium Enterprises,New & Renewable Energy,Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation,Urban Development & Poverty Alleviation,Vocational Training,Women's Development & Empowerment,Youth Affairs

detailsOfAchievement: The Micro Enterprises Development Co- Operative Society Ltd (M E D C S L) is a Community based organization of rural and urban slum women to promote household level micro-enterprises for sustainable livelihood of its members. The society came in to existence on 25-08-2009 and registered with the Deputy Registrar of Co- Operative Societies,Balasore Division of Odisha. The Mission Of MEDCL is "Sustainable Livelihood for Rural Youth & Women Through Promotion Of Micro-Enterprise in Rural Areas". The long Term Vision is to develop a viable and effective model so that the micro-credit is used by the women for productive purposes thus there is a visible change in rural economy. At present MEDCSL is functioning in 200 villages of three CD blocks of Balasore District i.e.Bahanaga ,remuna ,Balasore Sadar and 31 underprivileged slum areas of Balasore Municipality catering to the financial and livelihood need of 14,045women members. Over the years we have been supported by N A B A R D,P R Y O G,BASIX ,and Indian Gramin services (I G S)for various development projects and financial services in rural areas. During the last seven years the remarkable achievement of the cooperative society are as follows: (i) 1,316 women SHGs are formed in rural and urban slums of Balasore district involving 14,445 women members. (ii) 4,577 women S H G members are trained in S H G management and livelihood opportunities. (iii) Rupees three crore savings generated by the SHG members (iv) Rupees ten crore micro-credit loan was given to 10,000 women SHG members for farm based and non-farm income generation activities. (v) 4,000 nos of rural livelihood models demonstrated such as dairy , Goatary, Poultry,Fishery etc. for hands-in-learning and scaling up by women S H G members. (vi) Cooperative members were provided with social products such as water filter ,Solar Light ,smokeless chulla,sanitary napkins and health kits etc. MEDCSL has awell equipped office in Balasore Town. The office is fully furnished and Computerized with five 3rd Generation Computers,Printers,Scanner,Photo Copier and Broadband internet Connections. The total staff strength of MEDCSL as on 31st March 2016 is 42 of Which 27 (64.50%) are women.they are the grassroots Community level workers (Field Organizers)at the Villages /Ward and slums level who provide firsthand hand holding support to the women S H G members. Besides we have part-time experts on dairy,mushroom cultivation,food processing, woolen garments making and agarbati making who impart training to SHG members on specific trades.

isuues.value: Agriculture,Art & Culture,Children,Differently Abled,Dalit Upliftment,Education & Literacy,Environment & Forests,Health & Family Welfare,HIV/AIDS,Legal Awareness & Aid,Micro Finance (SHGs),Panchayati Raj,Right to Information & Advocacy,Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation,Women's Development & Empowerment,Youth Affairs

detailsOfAchievement: Legal Identity Mukti Rural Socio Economic Development Organization has been registered under Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 before the Additional Registrar of Societies, Nabarangpur, Orissa, India. The head office of the organization is situated at Khatiguda, 37 K. M. far from the district head quarter, Nabarangpur. The organization has been registered under section 12AA (2) of the Income Tax Act 1961. The Organization has also been registered under the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 1976. The Aims & Objects of the society 1. Striving for Social justice and Civil rights of women, youths, children, Indigenous people and Indian minority in religion and other weaker section people and work for their holistic development. 2. Promotion of welfare of destitute or handicapped children, youths, women and old age people through orphanages, Hostels and Homes; Imparting vocational training and helping for self-employment and organizing social rehabilitation. 3. Providing relief during natural calamities and emergencies. 4. Awareness on Health, Natural Resources Management, Responsible Citizenship, Self-employment and Income Generation through advance Technologies creating more opportunity for Research and Development. 5. Educational Development by formal, Non-formal Technical and Adult Educations, Diffusion of useful, scientific and trade and commercial knowledge and Development Education. 6. Economic Development of the Weaker Section by improvement of Agricultural productivity, by improvement of occupational and vocational skills, by promotion of poultry, Animal Husbandry, Sericulture, Pisciculture, Handicraft and appropriate cottage and Agro based Industries and by organizing co-operative societies. 7. Building up of healthy natural Environment, Development of forest, orchards, assist people to acquire low cost house and appropriate substitute to fire wood. 8. To record and give expression to the material opinion of the educated class on important and pressing socio, economic issues through discussions and deliberation. 9. Spiritual Development of Souls teaching good manner of life and responsible citizenship. 10. Organizing Rural Knowledge Centers and providing useful database of different Resources to bridge the information gap on rural development. 11. It shall organize meetings, work-shops, conventions and seminars to fulfill the aims and objects of the Organization. 12. Encourage Youth participation on different Games, Sports, Athletics, and their involvement in the development process conducted by the government, semi-government, and non-government organizations 13. It can make credit, thrift, insurance and deposit mobilization of rural poor and unemployed youth. 14. It shall co-operate to or receive co-operation form any individual, government organization or non-government organization within India or abroad for welfare and awareness of the people and the region. Moreover, we are working on Environment, Micro Finance, Women Empowerment, Right to Information, Water and Sanitation, Health, Education, Self Employment, and Socio Economic Issues of the weaker section people and the youth. Last year we have successfully completed the projects in collaboration with the Khadi and Village Industrial Commission, Ministry of MSME, Centre for Environmental Studies, Department of Forest and Environment, MAITRI: supported by Rajiv Gandhi Foundation, Social Welfare Board, Orissa, Bhubaneswar. We are eager to co-operate in all programs of the government, Non-Government Organizations and individuals similar to our aims and objects above. Chairman

detailsOfAchievement: TO EDUCATE THE INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY TO BE AWARE OF THEIR PROBLEMS AND SOLVE THEM WITH THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE THROUGH THEIR ORGANIZED AND COLLECTIVE ACTION. TO CO-OPERATE AND COLLABORATE WITH OTHERS IN IMPLEMENTATION DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME TO EDUCATE THE YOUTH ON NATIONAL INTEGRATION. FAMILY WELFARE, POPULATION CONTROL, PROTECTION OF ENVIRONMENT ETC. TO FACILITATE AND SUPPORT PEOPLE TO UNDERTAKE DIFFERENT DEVELOPMENTAL PROGRAMMES SCH AS WASTE LAND DEVELOPMENT, WATER-SHED MANAGEMENT, PRESERVATION OF FOREST, SOCIAL FORESTRY ETC. TO PROMOTE AND FACILITATE ESTABLISHMENT OF PEOPLES ORGANISATION, VILLAGE COMMITTEES, WOMEN ASSOCIATION AND YOUTH FORUMS IN VIEW OF ENABLING THEIR ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ALL RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMES. ACTION WOULD BE TAKEN TO REHABILATE LEPROSY PATIENTS,ACTION WOULD BE TAKEN TO CONTROL DREADED DISEASES LIKE CHOLERA, AIDS, MALARIA, ETC.ACTION WOULD BE TAKEN TO DEVELOP CULTURAL TALENTS AMONG YOUTH,ACTION WOULD BE TAKEN TO GIVE EMPLOYMENT TO RURAL YOUTH BY ENABLE THEM IN SKILL DEVELOPMENT. ACTION WOULD BE TAKEN TO INVOLVE THE YOUTH TO ERADICATE SOCIAL EVILS, LIKE BONDED LABOUR,CHILD LABOUR,ALCOHOLISM, DRUG ADICT, ILLITERACY,ETC.TO PROMOTE AND FACILITATE DRINKING WATER,HOUSING PRIMARY HEALTH CARE AND NUTITION TO THE NEEDY PERSONS FOR THEIR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN RURAL AREAS AND GIVE THEM EMPLOYMENT THROUGH SKILL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING. MAJOR ACTIVITIES ARE HEALTH CARE, PLANTATION, AWARENESS, ENVIRONMENT,AGRICULTURE, SHG FORMATION, HANDICRAFT DEVELOPMENT AND MARKETING, VOCATIONAL TRAINING.ADULT EDUCATION,CHILDCARE,DAY CARE, CARE FOR OLDER PERSON, WOMEN DEVELOPMENT.FINANCIAL LITERACY.

title: ORISSA DANCE ACADEMY
detailsOfAchievement: Founded in 1975 Orissa Dance Academy (ODA) is an institution engaged in teaching and promoting Odissi dance, music and related art forms. It has played a prominent role in popularizing and propagating Odissi in India and abroad. Its exemplary training method and skilled teaching staff have produced young solo dancers and innovative group compositions. Odissi dance has been predominantly performed by female danseuse. However, this institution has made it a priority to produce some of the most talented and versatile male dancers in the field of Odissi. ODAs repertory group has enthralled audiences in the U.S., Canada, U.K, South America, France, Holland, Japan, etc. Their faculties have taught all across India and abroad, including the United States. Our sole aim behind this project is to preserve, promote and popularize the art forms and cultural heritage at the national and international level.

Supported by CAPART. Preparation of Action Plan & Implementation of Indigenous Peoples Development Plan (IPDP) for 30 Male and 51 Female of Displaced Persons of Badanalla Irrigation Project in Livelihood promotion and skill building supported by Water Resources, Dept, Govt, Orissa. 300 volunteers from Kalahandi, Nuapara & Bolangir dist. Capacity building of village level volunteers on drought mitigation/ Community initiated Rain Water Harvesting and management supported by CAPART. 45 masons were trained. 20 model houses build in Padmapur block of Rayagada district, on Eco-friendly building materials and the construction process with low cost housing technologies, supported by CAPART. 200 house holds from 5GPs were supported with low cost house by Orissa Livelihood Restoration of Flood affected tribal People of Gudari & Chandrapur Blocks of Rayagada, Orisaa-(Phase-I &II). PRI Members of 4 blocks in PESA area in four districts were strengthening Good governance through civil society organizations, through advocacy in the PESA Area . supported by Hivos, Bangolre. 4600 acres and 5470 farmers covered & continuing Enhancement of livelihoods options for poor through sustainable agriculture Practices in Rayagada. Supported by SDTT, Mumbai. 325 trainings on livelihood promotion in 60 water shed and 7750 farmers coverd under training Livelihood promotion trainings in the watershed areas Trainings are imparted 18 thematic areas to community on agro-based livelihood promotion Cluster level livelihood resource center (JeebiKa), supported by Watershed Mission, ODISHA. 49 villages 3290 hhs and 5700ha covering 9 micro-watershed under Integrated Watershed Development (IWMP), K.Singhpur Integrated livelihood development through area saturation basis. Supported by OWDM, Odisha. 624 tribal farmers livelihood enhancement through orchard development and micro enterprise through WADI  NABARD project 300 farmers were promoted of pulses (Pigeon pea) through producer organizations Strengthening Agriculture Value Chain and Producer Organizations 300 farmers were promoted of Turmeric (Turmeric programme) Strengthening Agriculture Value Chain and Producer Organizations 30 nos. Set-up in 30 villages to cover 1500 ha Kharif irrigation Providing supplemental irrigation at least 50 hacters in Kharif and 5ha in Rabi in the tribal pockets for food security and livelihood promotion through Diversion Based Irrigation, supported by SDTT,Mumbai. 2200 nos. Mahila Kisan of 53 revenue village from 5nos. of GPs are trained on organic practices and 153 vegetable producer groups were established for Promoting livelihood food security among women farmer of south odisha, Mahila Kisan Sashaktikaran Pariyojana (MKSP), supported by NRLM,Govt.of India and SDTT, Mumbai 700 nos. beneficiaries from 14nos. of revenue village of 4nos. GPs were covered Household Food and Nutrition Security through FNS programme, supported by ICCO,Netherland. 14 villages & 17 Hamet villages in 6 micro-watershed were developed for Integrated livelihood development through area saturation basis. Integrated Watershed Development (IWMP-XII), Raigarha 4 Tribal blocks of Rayagda subdivision of Rayagada district are Facilitate Livelihood Interventions through Focused area development programme (FADP),ITDA-Rayagada.
